poem:
Remembering David Lodge  

In the room where words weighed heavy,  
David Lodge held the scales,  
careful in his judgments,  
a whisper in the artful shuffle.  
While lords of literates  
sidled in the bustling night,  
he captured tales from the ether,  
delivered them light—footed,  
a lingering voice amidst  
the chairs, books, and ink.
